archive_purpose: Papers 11+ ranked by relevance but not selected for primary research collection
selection_note: These papers were evaluated but ranked lower in relevance for ephemeral workload identity research compared to the top 10 selected papers. They remain valuable references for related topics.

archived_papers.title: The Human-Machine Identity Blur: A Unified Framework for Cybersecurity Risk Management in 2025
archived_papers.reason_for_archiving: Good coverage of NHI landscape, but less technical depth on attestation mechanisms compared to selected papers

archived_papers.title: CCxTrust: Confidential Computing Platform Based on TEE and TPM Collaborative Trust
archived_papers.reason_for_archiving: Strong attestation focus, but hardware-centric (TEE/TPM) rather than software workload identity mechanisms

archived_papers.title: A Confidential Computing Transparency Framework for a Comprehensive Trust Chain
archived_papers.reason_for_archiving: Relevant attestation concepts, but focused on hardware trust rather than ephemeral workload identity

archived_papers.title: Attestable Audits: Verifiable AI Safety Benchmarks Using Trusted Execution Environments
archived_papers.reason_for_archiving: Attestation mechanisms present, but focused on AI safety auditing rather than workload identity

archived_papers.title: Careful Whisper: Attestation for peer-to-peer Confidential Computing networks
archived_papers.reason_for_archiving: Innovative attestation protocol, but P2P focus diverges from container/cloud workload scenarios

archived_papers.title: Privacy-Preserving Decentralized AI with Confidential Computing
archived_papers.reason_for_archiving: Privacy and AI focus, but limited coverage of workload identity or attestation protocols

archived_papers.title: Confidential Federated Computations
archived_papers.reason_for_archiving: TEE verification relevant, but federated learning context less applicable to ephemeral workloads

archived_papers.title: SoK: A cloudy view on trust relationships of CVMs
archived_papers.reason_for_archiving: SoK paper on CVM trust, but cloud VM focus rather than containerized/ephemeral workloads

archived_papers.title: Secure API-Driven Research Automation to Accelerate Scientific Discovery
archived_papers.reason_for_archiving: API security and service mesh mention, but limited workload identity focus

note: These papers provide valuable context on attestation mechanisms, confidential computing, and trust frameworks, but were ranked lower due to: (1) hardware-centric (TEE/TPM) vs. software workload identity focus, (2) specialized use cases (federated learning, P2P networks) vs. general container orchestration, (3) performance/benchmarking focus vs. identity/authentication mechanisms.
